body.header: Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Click the correct letters a-c.

ol.li:
What percentage of the working population nowadays are women?
less than 20%
between 21% and 50%
more than 50%

Nowadays the average female manager's salary is between ...
£25,000–£29,000.
£30,000–£34,000.
£35,000–£39,000.

What is the principal reason for women going out to work?
They do not want to depend on other people for money.
They can no longer depend on husbands to support them.
They find life more expensive.

Changes in attitudes in the 1960s and '70s meant that more young women ...
were able to take office jobs.
went into temporary employment.
received a university education.

Which pie chart shows the proportion of men and women who are expected to start businesses in 2010?
Chart A
Chart B
Chart C

p.font: 1. Mary says that now women make up just over half of all employees. In other words more than 50%.
2. Mary says that the average annual salary for a female manager is £32,000. In other words between £30,000 and £34,000.
3. Mary says they want to be financially independent which means the same as not wanting to depend on other people for money.
4. Mary says that in the late '60s and early '70s girls started going to university. In other words received a university education.
5. Mary says women will be responsible for approximately half of all new business start-ups and this is illustrated by the 50/50 split on the pie chart.
